pr_title: Audit Log Event Implementation for Reset Password with integration tests

timeline.message:
Audit Log Event Implementation for Reset Password with integration tests

Added common code to call /v1/events endpoint to post audit log event and implemented fallback option with a scheduler.

Used @ConditionalOnProperty to conditionally load components from common-service.

Minor changes to audit log service and fixed the integration tests.

Removed fallback option code to reduce the PR#590 size

Removed fallback option code to reduce the PR#590 size

timeline.bodyText:
Unit tests should be independent of one another; having these dependency on previous tests means that if one of the early tests fails, all following tests will also fail which is misleading and can hide other potential failures.
Please fix and remove @order from all unit tests.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: We are using @Order only in integration tests. IMO, we can use @Order for integration tests but not in unit tests. I also checked SO post and Your tests shall not be ordered (shall they?)
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

replies.bodyText:
I would prefer to have isolated tests for both unit and integration tests.
Otherwise as I said, a failure in an earlier test would cause all following tests to also fail.
Also if you remove the dependencies, we could in future speed the tests up by making them run in parallel.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: I received similar comments on PR #664 so I removed @order from all the tests in PR #664 . PR 664 has been approved.
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.bodyText: this will removed as well.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.author: dhanyak-btc

replies.bodyText: We don't need these values at all; the final decision was to use a human readable enum field to identify each of these components.
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: I've created new enums as per new audit log requirements. Kindly review.
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.bodyText:
there is not a lot of value in constants that equal their own value. A better approach would be to name the constant as to what it is, similar to how a variable is named, and its value should be the content for your environment, class, etc.
If values are possible values for the same thing that can be used by the application, you have an enum hiding in your class.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Repeated string values extracted to constants to fix SonarLint issues, replaced Constants class with eum.
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.message:
Fixed #590 review comments and Created Issue #628

Fixed #590 review comments, Created Issue #628 to fix few review comments in followup PR.

Audit log implementation as per new requirements

Added following enums - UserAccessLevel, PlatformComponent, MobilePlatform
EncryptionUtils - replaced sha3_512Hex with sha512Hex
Refactored the code and tests.

timeline.bodyText: We are removing event names. Event code should be sufficient.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Removed eventName field
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.bodyText: event_id is sufficient. This should be removed. Please refer to the Audit log columns doc for the final list of fields.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Removed eventName field
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.bodyText:
let's not implement this for now.
Versioning is something that we have not discussed yet, we briefly talked about it a few months ago and decided to consider the whole platform as a connected entity and return the same fixed version for all until we have had the chance to revisit the API between the components.
So for here, let's return a single version for now. i.e. "application.version" works for now.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Replaced with application.version
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.bodyText:
description is also redundant for this event, since the action is taken by the same user and so the user_id field would point to the same user.
If description text is redundant, then it should not be skipped. Introducing free form text in the audit log, increases the chance of accidentally leaking PII and PHI, so I would like to limit that to events that absolutely need this information.
timeline.author: zohrehj

timeline.bodyText: please remove event name from the code entirely. EventCode field should be descriptive enough.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: Removed eventName  from this enum
replies.author: dhanyak-btc

timeline.bodyText:
I don't see the value of creating these event enums, Can you explain why you are creating them in advance and not calling a generic submit event method in the code itself?
also what happens if we integrated WCP or other mobile apps with the auth server. Do you expect to have a separate PASSWORD_RESET_SUCCESS event for each source component?
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.author: dhanyak-btc

replies.bodyText: ok, that sounds good.
replies.author: zohrehj

timeline.bodyText: please change the text for "unknown" to "Any other value. Should not happen"
timeline.author: zohrehj

+/*

+import lombok.Getter;
+
+@Getter
+@AllArgsConstructor
+public enum PlatformComponent {
+  MOBILE_APPS(
+      "MOBILE APPS", "The iOS and Android apps that participants use to interact with MyStudies"),
+

+

+
+  STUDY_DATASTORE(
+      "STUDY DATASTORE",
+      "This is the back-end component that manages the study builder data and holds the study configurations"),
+
+  SCIM_AUTH_SERVER(
+      "SCIM AUTH SERVER",
+      "This component implements login/consent flow and integrates with ORY Hydra for access and refresh tokens"),
+

+      "Auth Server",
+      "This is back-end component that manages user accounts and issues access and refresh tokens"),
+
+  PARTICIPANT_MANAGER(
+      "PARTICIPANT MANAGER",
+      "The UI that administrators use to invite participants to studies and track enrollment progress"),
+
+  CLOUD_STORAGE(
+      "Cloud Storage", "for storing and accessing data on Google Cloud Platform infrastructure");
